s.text: Weak governors also face limits of one or two terms, making them automatic lame ducks: They tend to govern less independently and exercise less clout with legislatures than strong governors, who, because they can repeatedly succeed themselves, amass more and more political power.

Weak governors also face limits of one or two terms, making them automatic lame ducks: They tend to govern less independently and exercise less clout with legislatures than strong governors, who, because they can repeatedly succeed themselves, amass more and more political power.
What makes a governorship strong or weak?

Weak governors also face limits of one or two terms, making them automatic lame ducks: They tend to govern less independently and exercise less clout with legislatures than strong governors, who, because they can repeatedly succeed themselves, amass more and more political power.
A strong governor also appoints most of the members of his Cabinet and can serve multiple terms.
A strong governor also appoints most of the members of his Cabinet and can serve multiple terms.
Personal charisma, a hefty electoral mandate, and the cooperation of the legislature can augment the power of any governor.
Voters elect the Texas attorney general, comptroller, general land commissioner, and state treasurer.
Add the likelihood of a major-party presidential nomination to the list, and you have a governor who wields a sizable amount of power, even if it can't be found in the state constitution.

The Texas governor can't grant clemency to a death-row prisoner, although he can grant a 30-day reprieve until a state board reviews the prisoner's plea.

The lieutenant governor presides over the Senate, appoints the Senate's committees and committee chairs, controls the flow of bills to the floor, and co-chairs the powerful Legislative Budget Board.

Most agencies in Texas are run by commissions or boards whose members outlast the governor who appointed them.
